creator: jkb@stian.freeserve.co.uk
text:
When used with JRE 1.3.1_01, the GUI fails to load, complaining that it cannot 
find file://C:\jakarta-jmeter/docs/usermanual/component_reference.html because 
the host "C" does not exist.

This is because the "file:" URL in 
src\core\org\apache\jmeter\gui\action\Help.java only has two //; it should 
have 3, i.e. it should be:

private static String helpPage =
		"file:///"
			+ JMeterUtils.getJMeterHome()
			+ "/docs/usermanual/component_reference.html";

The problem does not show up on JDK 1.4.1 - perhaps it is more tolerant?

When fixed, it works on both 1.3.1_01 and 1.4.1.

HTH

BTW, Version 1.8 seems to be missing from Bugzilla ...
[This bug relates to version 1.8 of JMeter]
creator: jkb@stian.freeserve.co.uk
jkb@stian.freeserve.co.uk
text:
Just noticed that the problem has already been reported as bug 13895 
(strangely, exactly 100 less!).
